name: poem-generator
body:
# Poem Generator.

## Generating random poems, from a defined Grammar.

The poem-generator project, consists of a solution of a programming exercise to create a random poem generator using the following grammatical rules:

***
`POEM: <LINE> <LINE> <LINE> <LINE> <LINE>`
`LINE: <NOUN>|<PREPOSITION>|<PRONOUN> $LINEBREAK`
`ADJECTIVE: black|white|dark|light|bright|murky|muddy|clear <NOUN>|<ADJECTIVE>|$END`
`NOUN: heart|sun|moon|thunder|fire|time|wind|sea|river|flavor|wave|willow|rain|tree|
flower|field|meadow|pasture|harvest|water|father|mother|brother|sister `
`<VERB>|<PREPOSITION>|$END`
`PRONOUN: my|your|his|her <NOUN>|<ADJECTIVE>`
`VERB: runs|walks|stands|climbs|crawls|flows|flies|transcends|ascends|descends|
sinks <PREPOSITION>|<PRONOUN>|$END`
`PREPOSITION: above|across|against|along|among|around|before|behind|beneath|beside|between|
beyond|during|inside|onto|outside|under|underneath|upon|with|without|through 
<NOUN>|<PRONOUN>|<ADJECTIVE>`
***

These rules are load from a file, and can be changed at any time, inside the project you can find this file in /main/resources/GrammarInput.txt

For getting a local copy of this project, you could try to clone the repo as follows:

1. $ cd workspace
1. $ mkdir poem-generator
1. $ cd poem-generator
1. $ git clone https://github.com/m4solutions/poem-generator.git
1. $ git fetch origin

```
If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.
